lead_paragraph: Arlen Kantarian, who brought blue courts and the women’s prime-time final to the United States Open, resigned Thursday as chief executive for professional tennis at the United States Tennis Association. In his nine-year tenure, Open revenue grew by $70 million and attendance increased by 150,000, to 720,000.
